elevator.rmi
Interface Motor

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
Elevator
All Known Implementing Classes:
MotorImpl
public interface Motor
extends java.rmi.Remote

The remote interface for controlling a motor of an elevator via RMI stub. The interface is implemented by the class elevator.rmi.impl.MotorImpl. An object with the MotorImpl class is created to control one elevator with a given number.

The Motor interace can be used to start moving the elevator up or down, to stop the elevator and to test a current position of the elevator. The getMotor(int elevatorNumber) static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the Motor object of a given elevator. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
     int elevatorNumber = 3;
     Motor m = MakeAll.getMotor(elevatorNumber);
     m.up();
     while (m.whereIs() < 2.888) sleep(10);
     m.stop();
It worth noting that an object with the elevator.rmi.Motor interface allows controlling only one motor, whereas an object with the elevator.rmi.Motors interface that allows controlling all motors at once, a group of motors or one motor.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Motors, Elevator, Elevators

Method Summary
 void down()
          Start this motor to move the elevator down.
 void stop()
          Stop this motor (stop the elevator).

          Start this motor to move the elevator up.
 double whereIs()
          Returs a current position of the elevator moved with this motor.
 

Method Detail

down

public void down()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Start this motor to move the elevator down. If not stopped, the elevator stops automatically when it reaches the bottom floor.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
up, stop, whereIs

stop

public void stop()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Stop this motor (stop the elevator).
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
up, down, whereIs

up

public void up()
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Start this motor to move the elevator up. If not stopped, the elevator stops automatically when it reaches the top floor.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException -  
See Also:
down, stop, whereIs

whereIs

public double whereIs()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returs a current position of the elevator moved with this motor.
Returns:
a double position of the elevator in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down, stop, up
